column4: Every time I have to enter my password to allow a program to run with sudo privileges, there is a grey overlay over my desktop - how can i deactivate that?
are you using desktop effects (compiz) or regular metacity?
regular Xubuntu - but it's the same in Ubuntu.. it's some sort of system default
ah, that's gksudo then, not sudo
yes, you're right...
run gksudo with the -g parameter
it should help
and how do i implement that with all programs in the menu?
you could set up an alias
or, the method I don't really like: rename the gksudo binary, create a script named gksudo which executes gksudo -g instead
rename gksudo and write a script to run that renamed gksudo with the -g option?
and what would that alias thing be?
that's something that would work, but I don't like it
you can create command aliases in your loginshell rc  (probably ~/.bashrc for you), I think ubuntu even comes with a default .bashrc_alias or so
unfortunately I only have german documentation at hand for it, but you will find something with a search engine such as google for sure
i'll stick with the script then... doesn't bashrc only get executed when i open a terminal?
i can work with German documentation *g*
syntax would be alias gksudo="gksudo -g"
http://wiki.ubuntuusers.de/Bash/bashrc#Wie-definiere-ich-ein-Alias-ueber-die-bashrc   there you go
danke
there is a german ubuntu channel as well, just as a sidenote.
I know, but chances to find help here are higher... and normally i do prefer english
